title: Remembering Perry Bamonte: The Cure's Multi-Instrumentalist
summary: Perry Bamonte, a guitarist and keyboardist for the iconic band The Cure, has passed away at 65. The band announced his death on their website, stating he died after a short illness at home over the Christmas period, expressing profound sadness. Described as quiet, intensive, intuitive, and hugely creative, Bamonte was a vital part of The Cure's history. He began as part of their road crew in 1984 and officially joined the band in 1990 following Roger O'Donnell's departure. Over his career, Bamonte contributed to five studio albums, playing guitar, keyboard, and bass on tracks such as Friday I'm In Love, High, and A Letter To Elise. He also appeared on live albums Paris and Show in 1993 and performed in over 400 shows across 14 years. After leaving The Cure, he became the bass player for the supergroup Love Amongst Ruin but rejoined The Cure in 2022, performing with them until 2024. The Cure, formed in 1976, is known for influencing goth, post-punk, and indie music. Bamonte was present when the band was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2019. Beyond music, he had a passion for fly fishing and worked as an illustrator for Fly Culture magazine.
